alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 17 at 8:29PM CDT until May 17 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT/915 PM CDT/ FOR CENTRAL CHEYENNE...WEST CENTRAL RAWLINS COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN KANSAS AND SOUTH CENTRAL DUNDY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... At 728 PM MDT/828 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles northeast of St. Francis, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Francis, Bird City, Parks and Wheeler. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
